newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian minister sees De Beers deal - Tass.
newsitem.headline: Russian minister sees De Beers deal - Tass.

text.p: Russian Finance Minister Alexander Livshits said on Friday that Moscow believed a deal on diamond exports with South African gem group De Beers was "essential" and could be signed next year, Itar-Tass news agency said.

Livshits last week suggested amendments to a draft agreement that is still being discussed after an interim accord was reached last February. De Beers have given the Russian government until the end of 1996 to approve the draft or face termination of the interim agreement.
Livshits was quoted on Friday as saying that Russia's relations with De Beers had been "normalised."
"Russia realises that such an agreement is essential," he said. "(It) could be signed in 1997," he added.
